title: Define and document the check-in/review workflow
Remove braids migrate command
acceptance_criteria: Remove 'migrate' command from CLI. Delete migration.clj, migration_io.clj, and all related migration specs. Remove migrate references from help and command dispatch. Migration is now agent-only when needed.

title: Update init.md for EDN registry format
acceptance_criteria: init.md updated: 1) registry.edn format instead of registry.md 2) Uses EDN {:projects []} instead of markdown table 3) All references registry.md → registry.edn 4) Cron job message: 'projects orchestrator' → 'braids orchestrator'

title: Orchestrator should detect and clean up zombie worker sessions

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Context: Workers that complete their bead but max out their context window linger as zombie sessions. The orchestrator sees them as running and skips the project (MaxWorkers limit), blocking the entire pipeline. Fix: orchestrator should detect sessions at context limit or exceeding max runtime, clean them up or exclude from concurrency checks, and notify when a zombie is found.

title: Update skill: project channels are planning-only, all work is async via beads
description: No direct work should be done in response to channel conversation. Channel interactions produce beads only. All implementation work happens asynchronously through the cron worker.

title: braids migrate: migrate existing installs
description: Migration command for existing installs. Handles: markdown registry to EDN, PROJECT.md config to project.edn, old paths to new paths, projects/ to braids/ skill rename.

title: Save braids-home in config file next to registry
acceptance_criteria: braids-home path persisted in config.edn alongside registry.edn

title: Add progress dashboard: auto-generate STATUS.md across all projects
Consolidate list and status into enhanced braids list
acceptance_criteria: braids list shows rich table with SLUG/STATUS/PRIORITY/ITERATION/PROGRESS/WORKERS/PATH columns. Always detailed and colored. Per-cell colors: STATUS (active=green, inactive=yellow, blocked=red), PRIORITY (high=red, normal=plain, low=yellow), PROGRESS colored by %. Remove separate 'status' command. Test with real project data.

title: Simplify worker spawn message — rely on AGENTS.md for onboarding
Specs must not assume OpenClaw is installed
description: Specs reference ~/.openclaw/skills/projects symlink, openclaw CLI, and ~/.openclaw/workspace/AGENTS.md. These break on a fresh clone. Specs should use project-relative paths (e.g. project-root/projects/) instead of installed symlink paths. Skip or mock openclaw CLI checks.

title: Set up cron job for autonomous work sessions
Update cron example in SKILL.md to 5 min interval
description: Cron integration section still shows everyMs: 14400000 (4 hours). Should be 300000 (5 min).

title: Handle skill updates gracefully across existing projects
description: When the skill format evolves, existing projects may have stale PROJECT.md/ITERATION.md formats. Strategy: 1) Workers should be tolerant of older formats, using defaults for missing fields. 2) For major breaking changes, create migration beads in affected projects. Document this in SKILL.md.

title: Update AGENTS.md with quality standards
acceptance_criteria: braids AGENTS.md updated with end-to-end verification requirements: 1) Redefine 'Done' to require CLI testing with real data 2) More specific acceptance criteria 3) Integration testing requirements 4) Safe testing practices (use test projects, never damage real data) 5) Document actual commands tested in deliverables. Text output preferred over screenshots.

title: Worker should explicitly handle bead dependency chains
CLI scaffold: bb project structure, braids entry point, arg parsing, help
description: Create the babashka CLI project: bb.edn with deps, src/ directory, braids main entry point, subcommand dispatch, --help system. Include speclj test infrastructure. This is the foundation everything else builds on.

title: braids new: interactive project creation
description: Interactive project creation flow. Replaces or drives project-creation.md reference doc. Asks questions, generates project.edn, AGENTS.md, iteration scaffold, registers in registry.edn.

title: braids orch spawn-msg: emit spawn message for sessions_spawn
description: Generate the spawn message (Project, Bead, Iteration, Channel) for a given bead. Used by the orchestrator agent after orch tick returns beads to spawn.

title: Move SKILL.md to projects/SKILL.md subdirectory
description: Skill lives at projects/SKILL.md within the repo so the symlink target is the projects/ dir, not the repo root.

title: Discord channel naming should be flexible, not prescribed
description: The docs currently suggest a specific naming convention for project Discord channels. The Channel field in PROJECT.md already supports any channel id or name, so the docs should reflect that the convention is a suggestion, not a requirement.

title: Set up a notification channel for projects-skill project
One-line install command in README
acceptance_criteria: README has a curl/bash one-liner that downloads and installs braids

title: braids iteration: show active iteration and bead statuses
description: Display active iteration for a project. Shows stories with status from bd, dependency graph, completion percentage. Integrates with bd CLI for bead status.

title: Replace PROJECT.md with .braids/config.edn
acceptance_criteria: PROJECT.md split into .braids/config.edn (structured config only) and AGENTS.md (goal, guardrails, prose instructions). No markdown config fallback. Multiple mentions supported per notification event.

title: Simulation tests: scripted orchestrator/worker scenarios against a test project
Replace 'Zane' with 'OpenClaw' throughout project files
description: Skill should be generic, not tied to a specific agent name.

title: Update skill: no work during iteration meetings, only bead creation
description: Check-in meetings are for review, discussion, and planning. Work output is bead creation only — no implementation during meetings.

title: Convert ITERATION.md to iteration.edn
acceptance_criteria: ITERATION.md replaced by iteration.edn. CLI reads only iteration.edn. No markdown fallback. Agents write iteration.edn.

title: Fix PROJECT.md: incorrect skill path in guardrails
description: Guardrails reference /Users/micahmartin/openclaw/skills/projects/SKILL.md but skill lives in the project repo itself at SKILL.md (symlinked from ~/.openclaw/skills/projects).

title: Move registry.md, orchestrator-state, and STATUS.md to ~/.openclaw/projects/
description: Registry and orchestrator state are agent infrastructure, not project content. Move from ~/Projects/ to ~/.openclaw/projects/. Files to move: registry.md, .orchestrator-state.json, STATUS.md. Update all references in orchestrator.md, worker.md, SKILL.md, CONTRACTS.md, init.md, project-creation.md, and specs.

title: Clean up global braids directory
acceptance_criteria: Remove bd workspace files from ~/.openclaw/braids/ (beads.db*, daemon.*, issues.jsonl, metadata.json, sync-state.json, etc.). Only keep braids state files (registry.edn). Remove .orchestrator-state.json. Keep directory name as 'braids' (no dot-prefix).

title: Replace projects-init shell script with interactive project-creation.md reference doc

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Create references/project-creation.md — a conversational guide the agent follows when a human says 'create a new project.' Steps: (1) ask for project name, goal, guardrails, (2) suggest defaults for autonomy/checkin/priority, (3) create Discord channel if applicable, (4) generate real PROJECT.md with actual content not TODOs, (5) set up AGENTS.md from template, (6) git init + bd init, (7) create iteration 001 and optionally seed stories, (8) add to registry, (9) review with human before committing. Remove projects/bin/projects-init and its test (test_projects_init.sh). Update SKILL.md, README.md, and INIT.md to reference the new doc instead of the script.

title: Fix braids iteration command bead display
acceptance_criteria: braids iteration shows actual bead titles and status instead of '? : [unknown]'. Properly handles bead lookup and status parsing. Tested with real iteration data.

title: Pretty-print EDN files
acceptance_criteria: All .edn files in braids use consistent pretty-printing with proper indentation. Add edn-format function and update all writers (registry.edn, config.edn, iteration.edn). Existing files reformatted on write.

title: braids list: show projects from registry
description: First real CLI command. Reads registry.edn, displays projects with status/priority/path. Human-friendly table output by default, --json flag for machine consumption.

title: Add configurable notification table to PROJECT.md
description:
PROJECT.md should have a notifications table where each notification type can be toggled on/off per project. Notification types:
- iteration-start: When an iteration begins
- bead-start: When a worker starts on a bead
- bead-complete: When a worker completes a bead (include summary)
- iteration-complete: When all iteration stories are done
- no-ready-beads: When no unblocked beads remain
- question: When a question arises needing customer input
- blocker: When a blocker prevents progress

Update SKILL.md, worker.md, and PROJECT.md format. Default values TBD.

title: AGENTS.md as universal entry point: point to worker.md, support non-orchestrator agents

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text:
Problem: (1) bd-generated AGENTS.md is boilerplate duplicated across every project and redundant with worker.md. (2) Only orchestrator-spawned workers know to read worker.md — ad-hoc agents have no guidance.

Solution: Replace bd boilerplate AGENTS.md with a project-aware version that:
- Points to ~/.openclaw/skills/projects/references/worker.md as the worker convention doc
- Also includes the public URL (clawhub.com or GitHub) for worker.md so agents on machines without OpenClaw installed can still follow conventions
- Contains project-specific context (bd quick ref, git push requirements) in minimal form
- Serves as THE single boot file any agent reads when entering a project

The skill should generate this AGENTS.md during project creation (bd init or project setup). Orchestrator spawn message can be simplified since AGENTS.md handles onboarding.

Eliminates duplication between bd AGENTS.md and worker.md. Any entry point — orchestrator, manual, external — gets full guidance.

title: Auto-generate iteration retrospective on completion
Migrate all tests to speclj + Babashka — replace bash test scripts

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Rewrite the entire test suite from bash scripts to speclj specs running on Babashka. Current tests to migrate: test_structural.sh, test_contracts.sh, test_simulation.sh, test_integration_smoke.sh, test_projects_init.sh. Set up bb.edn with speclj dependency. Create spec/ directory structure mirroring the feature areas. Replace tests/run.sh to invoke bb + speclj. Remove old bash test scripts once migration is verified. Update PROJECT.md guardrails to reference the new test runner. Update worker.md to tell workers to run bb specs not bash.

title: Orchestrator self-disables when idle
acceptance_criteria: Orchestrator disables its own cron job when no work is found (idle state). Manual re-activation required when starting new iterations. Remove backoff logic - use on/off instead. Zero token usage during idle periods.

title: Document agent spawning strategy in SKILL.md
description: SKILL.md lacks documentation on: MaxAgents field in PROJECT.md, how the cron checks running agent count before spawning, how sub-agents are labeled (project:<slug>), and the overall parallel execution model. This is a core part of the system and needs to be clearly described.

title: Rename skill from 'projects' to 'braids'
description: Rename the skill and all references from 'projects' to 'braids'. Scope: skill directory (projects/ → braids/), SKILL.md name/description, symlink (~/.openclaw/skills/braids/), all reference docs (orchestrator.md, worker.md, etc.), CONTRACTS.md, specs, README, AGENTS.md, cron job prompt, GitHub repo name (slagyr/project-skill → slagyr/braids or similar), registry path conventions, ~/.openclaw/projects/ → ~/.openclaw/braids/. This is a breaking change for existing installs — include migration notes.

title: Use descriptive filenames for story deliverables
description: Instead of just <story-id>.md (e.g. projects-skill-w9g.md), use a condensed descriptive name prefixed with the last 3 chars of the bead id. Example: w9g-extract-worker-orchestration.md. Update SKILL.md to reflect this convention.

title: Rewrite orchestrator.md to use braids CLI
description: Slim orchestrator.md from the current multi-page doc to: run braids orch tick, spawn what it says. Remove backoff logic, file parsing, frequency scaling — all now in CLI. The orchestrator agent becomes a thin wrapper.

title: CONTRACTS.md: document invariants for orchestrator, worker, and file formats
braids init: first-time setup
description: First-time setup command. Creates ~/.openclaw/braids/ directory, initializes registry.edn, sets up orchestrator cron. Replaces init.md reference doc.

title: Remove RETRO.md auto-generation feature — redundant with deliverables and bd list

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Remove RETRO.md generation from worker.md steps 7-8. Remove the .completing lock file mechanism (only existed for RETRO coordination). Remove RETRO contract tests and specs. Simplify iteration completion to: check no open beads, mark ITERATION.md status complete, notify channel. Existing RETRO.md files in completed iterations can stay as historical artifacts but no new ones should be generated.

title: Rename projects-home to braids-home
acceptance_criteria: All references to projects-home renamed to braids-home

title: Add README.md with installation instructions
description: Explain how to install the skill: symlink to ~/.openclaw/skills, install beads, etc.

title: Homebrew formula for braids
acceptance_criteria: brew install slagyr/tap/braids works, installs bb and bd as deps, braids is on PATH. README updated with brew install as primary method plus manual install steps for non-Mac users.

title: REVIEW.md only for blockers/questions, not progress summaries
description: REVIEW.md should only contain blockers and questions for the customer. If everything went smoothly, no REVIEW.md. Progress is captured in bead summaries.

title: Convert registry.md to registry.edn
acceptance_criteria: registry.md replaced by registry.edn in ~/.openclaw/braids/. CLI reads/writes only registry.edn. No markdown fallback.

title: bd init integration — auto-generate AGENTS.md, directory structure, and registry entry

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Already fixed. Root cause: sessions_spawn had no cleanup param, so every completed worker lingered as a zombie. Added cleanup: delete to orchestrator.md spawn call. Zombie detection remains as safety net for abnormal exits.

title: Support skill migration command via project channel
description: When the skill format updates, the user should be able to tell a project (via its channel) something like 'update to latest skill format' and the worker will: 1) Read the current SKILL.md for the latest PROJECT.md/ITERATION.md format, 2) Compare with the project's existing files, 3) Create beads to migrate any outdated files. This is a user-triggered migration path, not automatic.

title: Test end-to-end: create story, spawn sub-agent, produce deliverable
Cron should prioritize iteration story order, then bead priority
description: When picking work, follow the order stories are listed in ITERATION.md first, fall back to bd priority for unlisted beads.

title: Fix PROJECT.md settings rendering — use markdown list or double-space line breaks
description: Settings in PROJECT.md render as one line in markdown because single line breaks are ignored. Use a bullet list, a table, or trailing double-spaces to ensure one-per-line rendering.

title: Debug orchestrator agent behavior
acceptance_criteria: Investigate why orchestrator agent doesn't spawn workers despite orch-tick showing spawns and updated orchestrator.md instructions. Add debugging/logging to see what the agent is actually doing vs what it should do. Fix the actual execution problem.

title: Specs must not assume any projects exist
description: structural_spec and integration_smoke_spec read ~/Projects/registry.md and validate all registered projects. These fail on a fresh clone with no projects. Environment-dependent specs (symlink validation, registry checks, cross-project checks) should either be skipped when no registry exists or use temp fixtures like simulation_spec does.

title: Add 'planning' status for iterations
description: Iterations need a 'planning' status between creation and activation. Workers should only pick up beads from 'active' iterations, never 'planning' or 'complete'. This prevents work from starting before planning is finished. Update SKILL.md and worker.md references.

title: Clarify path conventions: ~ means user home, not agent workspace; add PROJECTS_HOME

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Already fixed ad-hoc. Added Path Convention section to SKILL.md, introduced PROJECTS_HOME (default ~/Projects), updated all references in SKILL.md and orchestrator.md, fixed registry.md paths from ~/projects/ to ~/Projects/.

title: Add comprehensive integration tests
acceptance_criteria: Integration test suite that creates real projects, iterations, and beads, then runs all CLI commands to verify they work properly. Tests actual end-to-end workflows, not just isolated functions. Catches bugs like the iteration display issue.

title: Add MaxAgents to PROJECT.md, cron respects running agent count
description: PROJECT.md gets a MaxAgents field (default 1). Cron should check how many agents are currently working on a project and only spawn more if under the limit.

title: Add runTimeoutSeconds to worker spawn to hard-kill long-running sessions
Add braids config command set
acceptance_criteria: braids config get/set/list commands for reading and updating config

title: Replace homegrown test framework with actual speclj — use the real library

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Worker built a 'speclj-inspired' mini framework in spec_helper.clj instead of using the actual speclj library. Replace with real speclj: add speclj dep to bb.edn, rewrite specs to use (describe ...) (it ...) (should ...) syntax, remove spec_helper.clj. speclj has native Babashka support. See https://github.com/slagyr/speclj for setup.

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Use speclj 3.12.0 (latest on Clojars). bb.edn dep: speclj/speclj {:mvn/version "3.12.0"}

title: Standardize iteration status format and add orchestrator format tolerance

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Workers reformatted iteration 006 status from 'Status: active' to '- **Status:** active' (markdown bold + list prefix). The orchestrator failed to recognize this as active for 12+ hours, burning tokens on idle backoff cycles. Fix: (1) Document the exact required format in orchestrator.md and worker.md, (2) Add a speclj spec that validates iteration status format, (3) Consider making the orchestrator instructions more explicit about format matching.

title: Move PROJECT.md and iterations/ into .project/ directory to reduce root clutter

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Move PROJECT.md and iterations/ into .project/ so the project root stays clean for actual project content. AGENTS.md stays at root (agent entry point convention). Update all references in SKILL.md, worker.md, orchestrator.md, CONTRACTS.md, project-creation.md, migration.md, and specs. This is a breaking change — existing projects will need migration. Document the migration path. This project (projects-skill) should be migrated as part of the bead.

title: Standardize terminology: use 'worker' not 'agent' throughout docs
description: Replace all references to 'agent' (when referring to spawned sessions doing project work) with 'worker'. Update SKILL.md, references/worker.md, PROJECT.md format (MaxAgents -> MaxWorkers), and any other docs. 'Worker' = an isolated session spawned to execute project tasks.

title: Migrate iterations/ to .project/iterations/ for projects-skill
description: ly3 moved PROJECT.md to .project/ but iterations/ is still at project root. Move iterations/ into .project/iterations/ and update any hardcoded paths in specs or references.

title: Fix Homebrew braids path resolution
acceptance_criteria: Homebrew-installed braids finds active iterations and ready beads correctly. Fix path resolution issues that cause 'No active iteration found' and 'No ready beads' when iterations and beads exist. Ensure consistency with development version behavior.

title: Validate multi-project support with concurrent active projects
Remove Budget from PROJECT.md format and all docs
description: Budget can't be meaningfully enforced right now — no reliable cumulative cost/token tracking available. Remove Budget field from PROJECT.md format in SKILL.md, PROJECT.md itself, and any references.

title: INIT.md: one-time skill setup reference — install skill, create PROJECTS_HOME, set up cron, first project

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Create references/init.md — a one-time setup guide an agent follows when a user says 'set up the projects skill' or similar. Steps: (1) install/symlink skill to ~/.openclaw/skills/projects, (2) verify bd is installed, (3) create PROJECTS_HOME (~/Projects) and registry.md, (4) set up orchestrator cron job with recommended config, (5) optionally create first project via projects-init. Also update README.md to point to INIT.md as the automated alternative to manual setup. Update SKILL.md installation section similarly.

title: Data format migration: registry.edn and project.edn schemas
description: Define EDN schemas for registry (replaces registry.md table) and project config (replaces PROJECT.md config fields). Write migration tool from markdown to EDN. CLI reads structured data from day one. PROJECT.md narrative sections (Goal, Guardrails) stay as markdown or fold into AGENTS.md.

title: Add notification rules to SKILL.md
description: Send notifications to project channel when: all iteration stories complete, no ready beads, questions arise, blockers arise.

title: Workers must generate RETRO.md before marking iteration complete

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Worker.md steps 7-8 require generating RETRO.md when an iteration completes, but iteration 004 completed without one. The worker either skipped the step or the race condition meant the 'winning' worker didn't follow through. This may be related to um4 (duplicate notifications). Ensure the worker that marks the iteration complete also generates the retro, and add a contract test: completed iterations must have RETRO.md.

title: Structural test script: validate files, symlinks, registry, and spawn config
Colorize braids ready output
acceptance_criteria: braids ready uses colors: priority badges (P1=red, P2=yellow, P3=green), bead titles (bold white), type/status indicators colored appropriately. Maintains readability while highlighting important info.

title: Colorize braids help output
acceptance_criteria: braids help uses colors: title (bold white), usage (bold cyan), section headers (bold yellow), command names (bold blue), descriptions (white). Clean readable layout with consistent color scheme.

title: Remove SKILL.md runtime dependency from orchestrator and worker
braids orch tick: orchestrator decision engine
description: The big one. Scans all projects, finds ready beads, applies concurrency rules, returns JSON: spawn these beads or idle. Replaces 80% of orchestrator.md logic. No backoff needed — CLI is zero-cost to run. Depends on ready command for shared logic.

title: Integration smoke tests: end-to-end validation after each iteration
Display project settings as a list in PROJECT.md, not single line
description: PROJECT.md settings (Status, Priority, Budget, etc.) should each be on their own line, not crammed together.

title: Delete tests/ directory — replaced by spec/ with speclj
Fix orchestrator spawning logic
acceptance_criteria: Orchestrator properly spawns workers from braids orch-tick results. For each entry in spawns array, calls sessions_spawn with correct parameters. Zaap and other project workers get spawned automatically. Test with real spawn results.

title: Add guardrail: channel agent must not modify project files directly — beads only

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: The channel/main session agent should only create beads, plan iterations, activate iterations, and review deliverables. It must NOT edit project files (SKILL.md, worker.md, orchestrator.md, PROJECT.md, CONTRACTS.md, etc.) directly. All file changes go through beads assigned to workers. Add this as a guardrail in PROJECT.md and document in SKILL.md as a project channel convention.

title: Orchestrator frequency scaling — reduce polling when no active iterations exist
Rename .project directory to .braids
acceptance_criteria: All projects use .braids/ instead of .project/. All references in skill docs, CLI code, worker.md, orchestrator.md, and specs updated.

title: Prevent duplicate iteration-complete notifications — guard against race condition

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: When multiple workers finish beads around the same time, each checks bd ready, sees no open beads, and sends an iteration-complete notification. Fix: worker should check ITERATION.md status before announcing — if it's already 'complete', skip the notification. The first worker to mark it complete wins; others see it's already done and stay quiet.

title: Support @mention in iteration-complete notifications for phone alerts

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Already fixed. Added mention syntax to iteration-complete notification in PROJECT.md. Worker includes the mention when sending the completion message to the channel, triggering a phone notification.

title: Cron worker is orchestrator only — spawns workers, does no bead work
description: The cron worker should ONLY: 1) read registry, 2) check active iterations, 3) count running workers vs MaxWorkers, 4) spawn async sessions (sessions_spawn) for beads, 5) sleep. It must NOT do any bead work itself. All bead work happens in spawned worker sessions. Update worker.md and cron prompt.

title: braids status: dashboard view
description: Show dashboard across all projects or single project detail. Replaces STATUS.md generation. Shows active iterations, bead progress, worker state. Human-friendly output + --json.

title: Remove STATUS.md dashboard generation
acceptance_criteria: Remove STATUS.md file generation from orchestrator. Delete references/status-dashboard.md. Remove Step 5 from orchestrator.md. Keep 'braids status' CLI command for live queries. Clean up STATUS.md references in docs.

title: Extract worker orchestration into projects/references/worker.md
description: Move all orchestration logic (registry check, agent counting, MaxAgents enforcement, work prioritization, spawning, notifications) from the cron prompt into projects/references/worker.md. Cron prompt should simply say 'read and follow projects/references/worker.md'. Single source of truth for the worker strategy.

title: Add Discord channel creation for project check-ins
braids ready: list beads ready to work
description: Core logic command. Lists beads that are open, have deps met, and project not at worker capacity. Shared logic with orch tick. This is the heart of the orchestrator decision engine extracted into deterministic code.

title: Workers must read PROJECT.md on startup for guardrails and config
description: Spawned worker sessions should read PROJECT.md as their first step to pick up guardrails, autonomy level, and other project config. Update worker.md to specify this.
notes: Workers must also read AGENTS.md on startup, not just PROJECT.md.

title: Migrate existing projects from PROJECT.md to project.edn
acceptance_criteria: braids migrate converts PROJECT.md to project.edn in all registered projects. Old PROJECT.md files removed after migration.

title: Tighten worker spawns to prevent zombies
acceptance_criteria: Workers reliably terminate after completing or failing a bead. No more zombie sessions lingering. Shorter default timeouts, worker instructions updated to exit cleanly, orchestrator spawn parameters optimized.

title: Formalize worker error handling and escalation path
Simplify README.md install: clone repo + symlink, remove manual setup steps

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Current README has too many manual steps. Simplify to: (1) git clone the repo, (2) symlink projects/ into ~/.openclaw/skills/projects. Two commands. Remove all the manual mkdir, cat, registry creation steps — those are handled by the agent-driven project-creation.md flow or INIT.md. README should be concise: what this is, how to install (2 steps), link to SKILL.md for details.

title: Add cleanup: delete to worker spawn to prevent zombie sessions by default

comments.author: micahmartin
comments.text: Already fixed. Root cause: sessions_spawn had no cleanup param, so every completed worker lingered as a zombie. Added cleanup: delete to orchestrator.md spawn call. Zombie detection remains as safety net for abnormal exits.
